* Generates a response for the user's chat message.
* Returns the most recent command processed by UI.
* Acts as a launcher class to work around classpath issues.
* A GUI for Carbon using FXML.

* An InvalidArgumentException is thrown if the arguments provided for a command are invalid.

* Creates two dialog boxes, one echoing user input and the other containing Carbon's reply and then appends them

* Deadline is a Task with a due date/time.
* Creates a Deadline with the specified description and due date/time.
* @param dueBy Due date/time of the Deadline.
* A Deadline's datetime is that of its due date/time.
* Additionally, the due date/time is included.
* Event is a Task with a start and end date/time.
* Creates an Event with the specified description, start date/time, and end date/time.
* @param start Start date/time of the Event.
* @param end End date/time of the Event.
public Event(String description, String start, String end) {
* An Event's datetime is that of its start date/time.
* Additionally, the start and end date/time is included.
return String.format("%s (from: %s, to: %s)", super.toString(), start, end);
* Task is an entry in the task list.
* Each Task has a description and a completion status (isDone).
public abstract class Task implements Comparable<Task> {
* Creates an Task with the specified description.

* Returns an icon representing the completion status of the Task.
* This is "X" if the task has been completed,
* or a space " " if the task has not been completed.
return (isDone ? "X" : " "); // mark done carbon.task with X
* Returns a String, formatted for text storage of the Task.
* @return Representation of the Task in text storage.
* Returns a String representation of the Task.
* This includes the label representing the type of Task, the completion status icon,
* and the description of the Task.
* Returns a Temporal representing the datetime of the task.
* @return Temporal representing the datetime of the task.
* A Todo is considered to have a date/time greater than non-Todo tasks.
* A Deadline is compared by its due date/time.
* An Event is compared by its start date/time.
* A TaskList manages a list of tasks.

* Creates a TaskList object with no tasks.
* Returns a String that lists all tasks in the TaskList.
return String.format("You have %d task%s:\n", tasks.size(), tasks.size() != 1 ? "s" : "")
* Returns a String that lists all tasks in the TaskList whose String representation
* Tasks are still numbered according to their original indices, rather than the
* indices by which they appear in the filtered output. This is because the user
* interacts with tasks based on their index in the TaskList, so presenting the
* original index of the task avoids confusion.
* @param filter The text to filter by.
throw new InvalidArgumentException("I expected some text after \"find\"");
? String.format("You don't have any tasks that contain \"%s\".", filter)
* Sorts the TaskList, then returns a String that lists all tasks in the TaskList.
* Returns true if the TaskList is empty,
* Returns the number of tasks in the TaskList.
* Adds a task to the TaskList.
* Returns a String representing the input task, along with the
* number of tasks currently in the TaskList.
* @return String representing the input task and TaskList size.
+ String.format("You now have %d task%s.", tasks.size(), isPlural ? "s" : "");
* Does nothing if the task has already been marked as done.
* @param index Index of the task in the TaskList to mark.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If index is out of bounds.
? String.format("Task #%d is already done (no changes made).", index + 1)
* Unmarks a task as done (i.e., marks as not done).
* Does nothing if the task has not been marked as done.
* @param index Index of the task in the TaskList to unmark.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If index is out of bounds.
: String.format("Task #%d has not been done (no changes made).", index + 1);
* Adds a Todo to the TaskList.
throw new InvalidArgumentException("I expected a description after \"todo\"");

* Returns a new datetime-type Temporal object representing the specified datetime.
* @param dateTime Datetime of the Temporal object.
* Returns the input String, capitalising "am"/"pm" at the end of the String (if applicable).
* DateTimeFormatter looks for capital "AM"/"PM", hence this is necessary for parsing.
* @param text Input String, possibly ending in "am"/"pm".
* Parses text into a date-type Temporal object.
* @return A date-type Temporal if possible, null otherwise.
// Text does not fit this format, continue to next formatter
* Parses text into a time-type Temporal object.
* @return A time-type Temporal if possible, null otherwise.
// Text does not fit this format, continue to next formatter
* Parses text into a datetime-type Temporal object.
* @return A datetime-type Temporal if possible, null otherwise.
// Text does not fit this format, continue to next formatter
* Returns a Temporal object of the appropriate type by parsing the input text.
* First attempts to parse the text into a datetime-type Temporal.
* On failure, attempts to parse into a date-type Temporal.
* On failure, attempts to parse into a time-type Temporal.
* On failure, returns a text-type Temporal.
* @return Temporal object obtained by parsing the text.
// Try parsing to datetime, then date, then time
* A text-type Temporal is considered to have a datetime later than a Temporal of any other type.
* A date-type Temporal is considered to have a time of 00:00 (midnight).
* A time-type Temporal is considered to have the current date.
* Returns a String representation of the Temporal.
* Todo is a Task with no date/time attached
* Creates a Todo with the specified description.
* A Todo is considered to have the latest possible datetime.

* Returns the most recent command as a String in lowercase.
* The command is the first word of the user's message.
* If user's message triggered an error, "error" is returned.
* If no command has been entered, "start" is returned.
